présent.name: Présent (Present)

tu.sentenceEnglish: Are you going to the cinema?

continu.name: Présent Continu
continu.description: Continuous present - action in progress right now

je.sentence: Je suis en train d'aller au travail.

tu.sentence: Tu es en train d'aller où?

il/elle.sentence: Elle est en train d'aller à la poste.
il/elle.sentenceEnglish: She is going to the post office.

on.sentence: On est en train d'aller au parc.
on.sentenceEnglish: We are going to the park.

nous.sentence: Nous sommes en train d'aller au marché.
nous.sentenceEnglish: We are going to the market.

vous.sentence: Vous êtes en train d'aller là-bas?

ils/elles.sentence: Ils sont en train d'aller à l'école.

présent.note: 'Aller' is highly irregular with complete stem changes in present tense!

passé.name: Passé (Past)

composé.name: Passé Composé
composé.description: Perfect aspect - completed actions with present relevance

ils/elles.sentence: Ils sont allés à la plage.

imparfait.name: Imparfait
imparfait.description: Imperfect aspect - ongoing or habitual actions in the past

je.english: I was going / I used to go
je.sentence: J'allais à l'école tous les jours.
je.sentenceEnglish: I used to go to school every day.

tu.english: you were going / you used to go
tu.sentenceEnglish: Did you often go to the park?

il/elle.english: he/she was going / used to go
il/elle.sentenceEnglish: She used to go to her grandmother's.

on.english: we were going / we used to go
on.sentence: On allait au cinéma le samedi.
on.sentenceEnglish: We used to go to the movies on Saturdays.

nous.english: we were going / we used to go
nous.sentence: Nous allions à la plage chaque été.
nous.sentenceEnglish: We used to go to the beach every summer.

vous.english: you were going / you used to go

ils/elles.english: they were going / they used to go
ils/elles.sentenceEnglish: They used to go to Paris often.

plus-que-parfait.name: Plus-que-parfait
plus-que-parfait.description: Pluperfect - actions completed before another past action

je.sentenceEnglish: I had gone to the store before.

il/elle.sentence: Elle était allée chez le docteur.
il/elle.sentenceEnglish: She had gone to the doctor.

on.sentenceEnglish: We had gone to the cinema.

nous.sentenceEnglish: We had gone to the park.

ils/elles.sentence: Ils étaient allés à la plage.
ils/elles.sentenceEnglish: They had gone to the beach.

je.sentenceEnglish: I went to see the king.

passé.note: Uses ÊTRE as auxiliary for passé composé and plus-que-parfait. Passé simple is mainly used in literature.

futur.name: Futur (Future)

simple.name: Futur Simple
simple.description: Simple future - actions that will happen

tu.sentenceEnglish: Will you go to the market?

proche.name: Futur Proche
proche.description: Near future - actions about to happen

je.sentenceEnglish: I am going to go to the cinema.

tu.sentenceEnglish: Where are you going to go?

il/elle.sentenceEnglish: She is going to go to Paris.

on.sentenceEnglish: We are going to go together.

nous.sentenceEnglish: We are going to go to the park.

vous.sentenceEnglish: When are you going to go?

ils/elles.sentence: Ils vont aller à la plage.
ils/elles.sentenceEnglish: They are going to go to the beach.

antérieur.name: Futur Antérieur
antérieur.description: Future perfect - actions that will be completed by a future time

je.sentenceEnglish: I will have gone before noon.

tu.sentenceEnglish: Will you have gone to Paris?

il/elle.sentence: Elle sera allée chez le docteur.
il/elle.sentenceEnglish: She will have gone to the doctor.

on.sentenceEnglish: We will have gone to the cinema.

nous.sentenceEnglish: We will have gone to the park.

vous.sentenceEnglish: Will you have gone before me?

ils/elles.sentence: Ils seront allés à la plage.
ils/elles.sentenceEnglish: They will have gone to the beach.

futur.note: Irregular future stem: ir- (not aller-). Futur proche uses present of aller + infinitive.
